content: I think the tables at http://build.fhir.org/search.html#table could use some updating, but I wanted to raise some questions/concerns here before opening GForge tickets.

first, on _profile:

  1. http://build.fhir.org/resource.html#search defines _profile as a search parameter of type reference (and search-parameters.json seems to agree)
  2. the underlying element is of type canonical
  3. the Common Parameters summary table claims _profile is of type uri
  4. the Primitive Types summary table says canonical data type is not mappable to reference OR uri

next, on Age:

  1. the summary table claims that the Age data type is not used in search
  2. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/condition.html#search defines onset-age with Condition.onset.as(Age) | Condition.onset.as(Range) which may resolve to type Age
there may be others as well, but those are the two I've seen thus far. should I open a single GForge or two separate ones?
@Yunwei Wang these look like technical correction candidates

accidentally submitted https://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=24918 before filling out the fields...can someone please mark that as a "Correction" or a "Clarification" and not an "Enhancement"?
I also opened https://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=24919 but managed to flag that as a Correction
you can't do that after submission? you should be able to
